title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 23-10.4 - Enclosed spaces
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 23-10.4 - Enclosed spaces

State Regulations

No stationary internal combustion engine shall be
operated under any conditions which allow introduction of its exhaust gases
into any occupied enclosed space. The operation of other internal combusion
engines within such a space is prohibited except for the necessary entrance and
departure of vehicles and except when such space is so ventilated as to assure
an atmosphere free from exhaust gases in a concentration tending to injure
health. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
23-10.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
